notes.note: Firefox now displays images and descriptions for search suggestions when provided by the search engine.

[Firefox for Android][1] now supports enabling [Global Privacy Control][2]. With this feature, Firefox informs the websites that the user doesn’t want their data to be shared or sold. This feature is enabled in private browsing mode by default and can be enabled in normal browsing in Settings → Enhanced Tracking Protection -> Tell websites not to share & sell data toggle.

[1]: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.mozilla.firefox_beta
[2]: https://globalprivacycontrol.org/

[Firefox for Android][1] can now be set as the default PDF reader.


  [1]: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.mozilla.firefox_beta

Firefox now supports animating the SVG  [viewBox][1] attribute using [SMIL][2] `by animations`. `by animations` are animations that are relative to the original value. Other attributes such as lengths and angles already support `by`, but a `viewBox` consists of four separate values.

[1]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/viewBox
[2]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/SVG_animation_with_SMIL

The [LargestContentfulPaint API][1] has been added, this provides timing information about the largest image or text paint before users interact with a web page.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/LargestContentfulPaint
`<hr>-in-<select>` is now supported, allowing websites to easily use separators inside a `<select>` element.
The `showPicker` method is now supported on `<select>` elements, this can be used to trigger the drop-down behavior via JavaScript.
The fallback URL parser for unknown schemes was changed to `DefaultURI` this improves specification adherence and web compatibility.

Added support for the [content-box][1] and [stroke-box][2] keywords of the [transform-box][3] CSS property.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/transform-box#content-box
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/transform-box#stroke-box
[3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/transform-box

Added support for [ray()][1] to the [offset-path][2] CSS property.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/ray
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path

Enabled the [offset-position][1] property which is useful for most of the [offset-path][2] values.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-position
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path

Added support for [basic-shape][1] and [coord-box][2] for the [offset-path][3] CSS property.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/basic-shape
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/box-edge#values
[3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path

Enabled the [ArrayBuffer.prototype.transfer proposal][1] methods, which enables transferring ownership of [ArrayBuffer][2] data.

[1]: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-arraybuffer-transfer
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/ArrayBuffer

Added support for [rect()][1] and [xywh()][2] basic shapes on [clip-path][3] and [offset-path][4] CSS properties.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/Element/rect
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/basic-shape/xywh
[3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/clip-path
[4]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path
Some machines with older AMD CPUs may see image thumbnails incorrectly render as all black in file dialogs. If this is the case, updating the graphics driver should address this issue.

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 10 or later

### Recommended Hardware
-  1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC)
-  1GB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  500MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.15 or later

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - glibc 2.17 or higher
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - libglib 2.42 or higher
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - PulseAudio
text:
Firefox Beta gets updated 3 times a week and as a consequence, the release notes for the Beta channel are updated continuously to reflect features that have reached sufficient maturity to benefit from community feedback and bug reports.

**Warning: Features listed here may or may *not* make a final release of Firefox.**

In addition to these release notes, you can follow ongoing development via our [@FirefoxBeta][1] Twitter account.


  [1]: https://twitter.com/firefoxbeta
title: Firefox 122.0beta Beta
